I'll help you walk through the Q-Flash Plus process for your Gigabyte B850 AORUS ELITE WIFI7 motherboard. Let me search for the specific instructions for your model.​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​



Based on my search results, I'll provide you with step-by-step instructions for using Q-Flash Plus on your Gigabyte B850 AORUS ELITE WIFI7 motherboard:

## Q-Flash Plus Instructions:

1. **Prepare a USB drive:**
   - Format a USB drive to FAT32 file system
   - Download the latest BIOS file for your motherboard from the Gigabyte website
   - Rename the BIOS file to "gigabyte.bin"
   - Copy this file to the root directory of your USB drive [![Gigabyte](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=892AFEA9-F8F3-469B-99B2-84B9B4D3DF80&%3D%3D)](https://www.gigabyte.com/Motherboard/B850-AORUS-ELITE-WIFI7-ICE-rev-1x)

2. **Set up your motherboard:**
   - Make sure your power supply is connected to the motherboard
   - Your system should be plugged in with the power supply switch turned ON
   - The system itself should be OFF (don't press the case power button) [![Glennsqlperformance](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=892AFEA9-F8F3-469B-99B2-84B9B4D3DF80&%3D)](https://glennsqlperformance.com/2020/12/22/how-to-flash-a-gigabyte-motherboard-with-q-flash-plus/)

3. **Locate the Q-Flash Plus USB port and button:**
   - On your B850 AORUS ELITE WIFI7, the Q-Flash Plus button is likely located on the rear I/O panel, to the left of the DisplayPort [![Tom's Hardware](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=892AFEA9-F8F3-469B-99B2-84B9B4D3DF80&)](https://www.tomshardware.com/pc-components/motherboards/gigabyte-b850-aorus-elite-wifi-7-review)
   - The specific Q-Flash Plus USB port should be labeled on your motherboard

4. **Perform the Q-Flash:**
   - Insert your prepared USB drive into the designated Q-Flash Plus USB port
   - Press the Q-Flash Plus button to trigger the automatic BIOS update process [![Gigabyte](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=892AFEA9-F8F3-469B-99B2-84B9B4D3DF80&)](https://www.gigabyte.com/Motherboard/B850-AORUS-ELITE-WIFI7-ICE-rev-1x)
   - You should see LED activity and possibly fans turning on, indicating the update is in progress [![Glennsqlperformance](claude-citation:/icon.png?validation=892AFEA9-F8F3-469B-99B2-84B9B4D3DF80&%3D%3D)](https://glennsqlperformance.com/2020/12/22/how-to-flash-a-gigabyte-motherboard-with-q-flash-plus/)

5. **Wait for completion:**
   - The process typically takes 2-5 minutes
   - Wait for all LED activity to stop before proceeding
   - Do NOT interrupt the process by turning off power or removing the USB drive

6. **After completion:**
   - Once the flashing process is complete, remove the USB drive
   - Restart your system
   - Your motherboard should now boot with the updated BIOS

This method is especially useful in your situation where you're having trouble with a first boot on a new system. The Q-Flash Plus feature allows you to update the BIOS without needing a working system, which should help resolve your current boot issues.
